title: Cyril Woolford
text:
Cyril Woolford ( – 30 November 2018) was an English professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1940s, 1950s and 1960s. He played at representative level for <a href="Rugby%20League%20War%20of%20the%20Roses">Yorkshire</a>, and at club level for <a href="Castleford%20Tigers">Castleford</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Castleford%20Tigers%20players">Heritage № 313</a>), <a href="Doncaster%20R.L.F.C.">Doncaster</a> (Heritage № 52), and <a href="Featherstone%20Rovers">Featherstone Rovers</a> (<a href="list%20of%20Featherstone%20Rovers%20players">Heritage № 370</a>) (<a href="vice-captain">vice-captain</a>), as a , or , i.e. number 2 or 5, or, 3 or 4, he was a committee member at <a href="Featherstone%20Rovers">Featherstone Rovers</a> for a number of years.
Background.
Cyril Woolford's birth was registered in <a href="Tadcaster">Tadcaster</a>, <a href="West%20Riding%20of%20Yorkshire">West Riding of Yorkshire</a>, England, he lived in the <a href="Featherstone">Featherstone</a> area, he was a <a href="Major%20appliance">domestic appliance</a> <a href="technician">technician</a>.
Playing career.
County honours.
Cyril Woolford won <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a>s for <a href="Rugby%20League%20War%20of%20the%20Roses">Yorkshire</a> while at <a href="Featherstone%20Rovers">Featherstone Rovers</a>; he played right-, i.e. number 3, in the 25-11 victory over <a href="Rugby%20League%20War%20of%20the%20Roses">Lancashire</a> in the <a href="1957%E2%80%9358%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20County%20Championship">1957–58</a> <a href="County%20Championship%20%28rugby%20league%29">County Championship</a> during the <a href="1957%E2%80%9358%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1957–58 season</a> at <a href="Halton%20Stadium">Naughton Park</a>, <a href="Widnes">Widnes</a> on Monday 23 September 1957, and played , i.e. number 5, and scored a <a href="Try%20%28rugby%29">try</a> in the 38-28 victory over <a href="Rugby%20League%20War%20of%20the%20Roses">Lancashire</a> in the <a href="1959%E2%80%9360%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20County%20Championship">1959–60</a> <a href="County%20Championship%20%28rugby%20league%29">County Championship</a> during the <a href="1959%E2%80%9360%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1959–60 season</a> at <a href="Hilton%20Park%20%28stadium%29">Hilton Park</a>, <a href="Leigh%2C%20Greater%20Manchester">Leigh</a> on Wednesday 11 November 1959.
County Cup Final appearances.
Cyril Woolford played , i.e. number 5, scored a <a href="Try%20%28rugby%29">try</a>, and was <a href="vice-captain">vice-captain</a> in <a href="Featherstone%20Rovers">Featherstone Rovers</a>' 15-14 victory over <a href="Hull%20F.C.">Hull F.C.</a> in the <a href="1959%E2%80%9360%20Yorkshire%20Cup">1959–60</a> <a href="RFL%20Yorkshire%20Cup">Yorkshire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1959%E2%80%9360%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1959–60 season</a> at <a href="Headingley%20Stadium%23Rugby%20ground">Headingley</a> <a href="Headingley%20Rugby%20Stadium">Rugby Stadium</a>, <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a> on Saturday 31 October 1959.
Club career.
Cyril Woolford made his début for <a href="Featherstone%20Rovers">Featherstone Rovers</a> on Saturday 7 April 1956, he broke <a href="Eric%20Batten">Eric Batten</a>'s "most tries in a season" record for <a href="Featherstone%20Rovers">Featherstone Rovers</a>, by scoring 31-<a href="Try%20%28rugby%29">tries</a> during the <a href="1959%E2%80%9360%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1959–60 season</a>, this record was later extended to 48-tries by <a href="Paul%20Newlove">Paul Newlove</a> during the <a href="1992%E2%80%9393%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1992–93 season</a> (albeit at <a href="Rugby%20Football%20League%20Championship%20Second%20Division">Second Division</a> level), and he played his last match for Featherstone Rovers during the <a href="1960%E2%80%9361%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1960–61 season</a>.
Honoured at Featherstone Rovers.
Cyril Woolford is a Featherstone Rovers Hall of Fame inductee.
Personal life.
Cyril Woolford's marriage to Elizabeth (<a href="Given%20name%23Name%20at%20birth">née</a> Bradburn) (<a href="http%3A//www.freebmd.org.uk/cgi/information.pl%3Fcite%3DkgCd5%252B6zRkSCMoB5rlwJCA%26amp%3Bscan%3D1">birth registered</a> during third ¼ in <a href="Pontefract">Pontefract</a> district) was registered during second ¼ 1954 in <a href="Pontefract">Pontefract</a> district. They had children; the future rugby league who played in the 1980s for Featherstone Rovers (<a href="list%20of%20Featherstone%20Rovers%20players">Heritage № 604</a>); <a href="Neil%20Woolford">Neil M. Woolford</a> (<a href="http%3A//www.freebmd.org.uk/cgi/information.pl%3Fcite%3DLJpXloGRMEH8OV4b%252B0bU%252FQ%26amp%3Bscan%3D1">birth registered</a> during first ¼ in <a href="Wakefield">Wakefield</a> district). Cyril Woolford was the grandfather of the <a href="association%20football">association football</a>er; <a href="Martyn%20Woolford">Martyn Woolford</a>.
